Package mz

package mz
  • Related Packages
    Package
    Description
    mz.intro
     
  • Class
    Description
    Bubble
    Bubble Sort is a simple sorting algorithm that repeatedly compares adjacent elements and swaps them if they are in the wrong order.
    Cocktail
    Cocktail Sort, also known as Cocktail Shaker Sort or Bidirectional Bubble Sort, is a variation of the Bubble Sort algorithm.
    Comb
    Comb Sort is a comparison-based sorting algorithm that is an improvement over Bubble Sort.
    Counting
    Counting Sort is a non-comparison based sorting algorithm that sorts elements based on their numeric values.
    DoubleSelection
    Double Selection if an item is not the smallest item, it's possible to check to see if it's the largest item and if it is, move it to the end of the array.
    DualPivotQuick
    Dual Pivot Quick Sort is an enhanced version of the traditional Quick Sort algorithm that uses two pivot values to partition the array instead of one.
    Gnome
    Gnome Sort, also known as Stupid Sort, is a simple sorting algorithm that works by repeatedly comparing adjacent elements and swapping them if they are in the wrong order.
    Heap
    Heap Sort is a comparison-based sorting algorithm that uses a binary heap data structure to sort elements.
    HeapInterface<T extends Comparable>
    HeapInterface, containing the methods of Heap Sort to implement other classes.
    Insertion
    Insertion Sort is a simple sorting algorithm that builds the final sorted array one element at a time.
    InsertionInterface<T extends Comparable>
    InsertionInterface, containing the methods of Insertion Sort to implement other classes.
    Merge
    Merge Sort is a comparison-based sorting algorithm that follows the divide-and-conquer approach.
    Merge3
    Merge3 Sort the sorting process is divided into three parts and performed incrementally.
    MergeInPlace
    Merge In Place Sort is a variant of the merge sort algorithm that performs the sorting operation directly on the input array, without using any additional arrays for merging.
    MergeInsertion
    Merge Insertion Sort or the Ford–Johnson algorithm is a comparison sorting algorithm.
    MergeInterface<T extends Comparable>
    MergeInterface, containing the methods of Merge Sort to implement other classes.
    OddEven
    The Odd-even (Brick) Sort algorithm is a variation of the Bubble Sort algorithm that is specifically designed to sort arrays in parallel.
    Quick
    Quick Sort is a widely used comparison-based sorting algorithm that follows a divide-and-conquer approach.
    Quick3
    Quick Sort 3-Way in simple QuickSort algorithm, we select an element as pivot, partition the array around a pivot and recur for subarrays on the left and right of the pivot.
    QuickInterface<T extends Comparable>
    QuickInterface, containing the methods of Quick Sort to implement other classes.
    Selection
    Selection Sort is a simple sorting algorithm that works by dividing an array into two parts: a sorted portion and an unsorted portion.
    SelectionInterface<T extends Comparable>
    SelectionInterface, containing the methods of Selection Sort to implement other classes.
    Shell
    Shell Sort is an efficient sorting algorithm that is an extension of Insertion Sort.
    SmoothHeap
    Smooth Heap Sort it is another version of heapsort that is designed to minimize the number of comparisons performed during the sort.
    Sort<T>
    The topmost interface of the hierarchy, through which all other interface, abstract, super, sub, classes are available with polymorphism.
    Sort.SortType
    You can set the desired sort by specifying sort type.
    SortComparable
    The inheritors of this abstract class arrange any data type that is Comparable.
    SortFind<T extends Comparable>
    SortFind offered a pre-implemented methodology that can be added and modified outside the hierarchical system.
    SortLong
    The inheritors of this abstract class arrange any data type that is Long.
    SortSwap<T extends Comparable>
    The inheritors of this interface arrange any data type that is T.
    StableQuick
    Stable QuickSort is an extension of the QuickSort algorithm that aims to preserve the relative order of elements with equal values during the sorting process.
    TernaryHeap
    Ternary Heap Sort which uses a ternary heap instead of a binary heap; that is, each element in the heap has three children.
    Tim
    Tim Sort is a hybrid sorting algorithm that combines the strengths of Merge Sort and Insertion Sort to achieve efficient and stable sorting.
    WeakHeap
    Weak Heap Sort construction uses a buffer that supports constant-time insertion.
    WeaveMerge
    Weave Merge Sort is a variation of the Merge Sort algorithm that aims to achieve better performance by reducing the number of array copies during the merging step.
    Wiki
    Wiki Sort, also known as Block Merge Sort, is an efficient comparison-based sorting algorithm designed to improve upon the performance.
